article.headline: Boston U. 71, Youngstown State 55
article.story: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (AP) -- Rashad Bell scored 18 of his 24 points in the first half and Boston University beat Youngstown State 71-55 on Saturday. Bell hit eight of nine first-half shots and finished 10-of-13 for the game. He also made 4-of-8 free throws for BU (2-1). Kevin Gardner and Chaz Carr had 14 points apiece for BU and Etienne Brower scored 12. Youngstown State (2-1) was led by Derrick Harris with 14 points and Quin Humphrey with 12. BU, which never trailed, went on an early 9-0 run to lead 13-2 with 16:07 left in the first half on Matt Wolfe's jumper. The Penguins cut the lead to four points four times in the first half, the last on Harris' 3-pointer to go into halftime losing 36-32. After Brower missed a 3-pointer to begin the second half, John Barber hit a free throw with 19:11 left to get Youngstown State within 36-33. A layup by Brower, free throws by Brower and Bell and a Carr 3-pointer kicked off a 15-1 run to make it 51-34 with 12:32 left to play.
